column4: I am trying to setup my partitions to avoid grub 18 error (my bios is very old and needs the boot at the begining of the disk).  Will the guided partitioner do this automatically with ubuntu 8.10 or do i need to set it up manually?
avoid grub ? means remove grub ?
I am avoiding a grub error
have you try, um.. rescue mode ?
I have an empty disk
have you try, you can re-install grub
have you try, use live-cd(ubuntu)
my grub needs its own partition
have you try, bootable ubuntu-cd i mean
yes
of course it needs partition to install
you just said you have an error when you boot your system right ?
that means you need to re-install grub
if you formatted your hard-drive already
ok, so do you know how ?
ok ok wait i missed your msg..
hmm..;;
ok now i understood
:P
make extra partition for it then ?
to make extra partiton for grub, you need to use fdisk
i meant to solve your problem, use console cmd, that will be better
